div.p: CALENDAR
PARENT PORTAL
EMPLOYEE PORTAL
CAFETERIA MENU

p.span: Beginning the week of April 6th, new content will be released every Monday through the end of the school year to allow students to continue learning while helping families keep track of resources and assignments.

strong.span: Click the buttons below to access the new information each week!

div.p: Â Â Â

p.span: ECCÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â ELEMÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â MSÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â HS

div.p: Â
Student belongings can be picked up between 8:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. on Tuesday, April 21st and Thursday April 23rd, 2020.Â Â
PreK & 1st grade items can be picked up in the office parking lot (North).Â Kindergarten items can be picked up in the kindergarten parking lot (South).

Persons picking up items are asked to stay in their vehicle.Â Please drive into the designated lot and a teacher will ask the childâ€™s name and class.Â A bag containing the studentâ€™s items will be placed next to your vehicle.Â We are asking to reduce contact that you exit your vehicle at this time and pick up the bag.Â There will also be a tote placed on the sidewalk to place any items that need to be returned to the school (i.e. textbooks, library books, literacy backpacks, etc).

Student belongings can be picked up between 8:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. on Tuesday, April 21st and Thursday, April 23rd, 2020.Â Enter the drive thru by heading north on South 8th Avenue (One Way) turning into the drop off area in front of the elementary school library.Â Please remain in your vehicle, tell the teacher your childâ€™s name, and supplies will be brought out and set on the sidewalk for pickup.Â There will also be a tote placed on the sidewalk to place any items that need to be returned to the school (i.e. textbooks, library books, etc).Â Any supplies or items left in your childâ€™s classroom or locker will be in their bag.Â Â

Next Tuesday April 21st and Thursday April 23rd, from 8:00am-1:00pm. We will have an opportunity for students to get the contents of their school lockers.Â We will allow students to gather their belongings as well as return any school items they need to return. This would include library books, textbooks, uniforms, fundraisers and other items. Students will enter the building through the front door, drop off any belongings that they need to return. Stop by their locker and then exit the back door of the middle school. No more than four students will be allowed in the building at a time and proper social distancing needs to be maintained at all times. If there are already three students in line to enter the building please wait until you can fill in the line. Spots will be marked to assist in social distancing while waiting to get into the building. As students exit the back door to be picked up, another student will be allowed in the front door.Â

Next Tuesday April 21st and Thursday 23rd, we will have an opportunity for students to get the contents of their school lockers. The high school students will have times for each individual grades to come to the school and gather their belongings as well as return any school items they need to return. This would include library books, textbooks, uniforms, instruments, fundraisers and other items. Students will enter the building through the front door, drop off any belongings that they need to return. Stop by their locker and then exit the back door of the high school. No more than four students will be allowed in the building at a time and proper social distancing needs to be maintained at all times. If there are already three students in line to enter the building please wait until you fill in the line. Spots will be marked to assist in social distancing while waiting to get into the building. As students exit the back door to be picked up, another student will be allowed in the front.Â Â

p.span: Â Â Â 8:00 A.M. - 10:00A.M.Â Â Â Â Â Â Freshmen class
Â Â Â 10:00A.M. - 12:00 P.M.Â Â Â Â Â Â Sophomore class
Â Â Â 8:00 A.M. - 10:00 P.M.Â Â Â Â Â Â Junior Class
Â Â Â 10:00A.M. - 12:00 P.M.Â Â Â Â Â Â Senior Class

div.p: Â
Either group will be allowed to pick up from 12:00pm-1:00pm on each assigned day.

div.p: 1 de abril de 2020
Estimados padres y miembros de la comunidad:

Nuestra esperanza es mantener la estabilidad para los estudiantes y las familias mientras brindamos un aprendizaje basado en actividades y enriquecimiento en un entorno de aprendizaje combinado. El Aprendizaje a Distancia no es solo una instrucciÃ³n en lÃ­nea. El propÃ³sito de esta guÃ­a es llenar los vacÃ­os y responder cualquier pregunta que pueda tener en las prÃ³ximas semanas. Nuestra metodologÃ­a proporcionarÃ¡ enriquecimiento en lÃ­nea y con paquetes basados en el hogar segÃºn sea necesario. Consulte nuestra pÃ¡gina de Aprendizaje a Distancia en el sitio web de nuestra escuela para obtener mÃ¡s recursos e informaciÃ³n. No sabemos quÃ© traerÃ¡n los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as en lo que respecta a la educaciÃ³n tradicional, pero sÃ­ sabemos que es el momento perfecto para disfrutar a su hijo y aprender junto con ellos.

div.p: Â

Madill servirÃ¡ almuerzos para llevar, recogidos en la cafeterÃ­a de la escuela primaria. Para proteger mejor a los miembros de nuestro personal y a las familias, estamos ajustando nuestro horario para recoger dos veces por semana, lunes y miÃ©rcoles. El horario de recogida serÃ¡ de 10 a.m. a 12 p.m. Consulte la informaciÃ³n del itinerario a continuaciÃ³n para el servicio de comidas. AÃºn recibirÃ¡ diez comidas en total durante la semana, pero solo le pedimos que la recoja de la siguiente manera:
Lunes: desayuno y almuerzo para Lunes y Martes

section.h4: Parade Planned to Honor Seniors May 15; Lights to Shine to Illuminate Accomplishments

img.alt: Parade Planned to Honor Seniors May 15; Lights to Shine to Illuminate Accomplishments

a.aria-label: Full Article For Parade Planned to Honor Seniors May 15; Lights to Shine to Illuminate Accomplishments
Source Information for News from In and Around MHS

cite.a: News from In and Around MHS

p.span: Madill Public School and 98.7FM are sponsoring the Senior 2020 Celebration Parade on May 15, 2020 at 7:00pm.Â Seniors can decorate their vehicles and parade down Lillie and around the Square.Â During this time, messages from teachers and recognition of student accomplishments will play on the radio.Â Â Patrons can line the streets while tuning into the radio to support our Wildcat Seniors.Â Following the parade we will light up the sporting fields around town from 8-9pm.Â More specific information and parade route will follow in the upcoming weeks.Â Seniors please forward your information to Mrs. Clement as soon as possible.

div.p: Beginning April 6th, Madill will be serving grab and go lunches, picked up at the elementary cafeteria drive thru. Â In order to better protect our staff members and families, we are adjusting our schedule to pick up two times weekly, Monday and Wednesday. The pick-up time will remain from 10 am to 12 pm. Â You will still receive ten meals total for the week but only pick them up twice a week. Â Monday you will receive (2) â€“Â breakfast and lunches for Monday and Tuesday, Â Wednesday you will receive (3) â€“Â breakfast and lunches for Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.
